conbody.p: This book contains the following chapters:

li.p: Describes SenSage AP Analytics and IntelliSchema.
Provides required configuration for the IT Detection Model, which uses log events and human resources information to compute a daily insider threat risk score.
Provides a list of sample models included in your system for working with Analytics Workbench.
Provides a sample model description to include a notification when a given threshold is exceeded in a report.
Provides reference on the IntelliSchema views on which SenSage AP Analytics reports run.
Provide brief overview on each available report category provided with your SenSage AP software, reports contained in them, and a brief description of each report.
Provides reference on the SenSage AP Compliance Analytics Reports
Provides reference on the SenSage AP Analytics Foundation Reports for Microsoft Windows
Provides reference on the SenSage AP Analytics Foundation Reports for Unix/Linux
Provides reference on the following group or reports: EDW command tools usage reports, Collector activity reports, and internal system reports.
Provides reference on the SenSage AP McAfee Analytics Reports
Provides reference on the SenSage AP BlueCoat Reports
Provides reference on the HawkEye G Analytics Reports
Provides reference on the SenSage AP Panos Reports
Provides reference on the SenSage AP SAP Reports
Provides reference on the SenSage AP Miscellaneous Reports.

ul.li:
Remaining chapters
Provide information for System Administrators on how to configure SenSage AP Log Adapters for a variety of sources. Log adapters allow SenSage AP to access and store data from software and hardware devices.

Appendix A:
Provide functions for common look-up and conversion operations that apply to SQL reports.

Appendix B:
Provides a reference for System Administrators on setting up syslog-ng.
